en: On crowded buses young people should give their seats to old people.
zh: 在拥挤的公共汽车上，年轻人应该给老年人让座。

en: Antique carpets are especially valuable.

en: Great pains but all in vain.

en: All my effort went for nothing.

en: With his muscular constitution he passes for a judoist.

en: I'm worn out by the hard work.

en: It'll take the bone a month or so to set completely.

en: I don't like to eat fish with many bones.

zh: 我不喜欢吃刺多的鱼。

en: Love sees no faults.

en: I have a bad pain in my lower back.

zh: 我刚开始只想在这家公司待一段时间，但不知不觉就成了老员工了。

en: Please take this seat.

en: Who's pulling the strings behind the scenes?

en: Black people were compelled to work in cotton fields.

zh: 黑人不得不坐在公共汽车的后面，或者如果后面满了就站着。

en: There is still serious racial hatred against black people.
zh: 现在仍然存在对黑人的严重种族仇恨。

en: Dark clouds are hanging low.

en: Black clouds spread over the sky.
zh: 乌云布满天空。

en: Two blacks do not make a white.
zh: 两黑不成白。

en: Black becomes you.
zh: 黑色很适合你。

en: Isn't it black?
zh: 不是黑色的吗？

en: I saw a woman in black.

en: Black cloth absorbs light.
zh: 黑布吸收光线。

en: It was an old man that was hit by the black car.

en: Black paper absorbs light.

en: Black clouds are gathering. It's going to rain.

en: A black coat is in fashion this winter.
zh: 今年冬天流行黑色外套。

en: Black coats are in fashion this winter.
zh: 今年冬天流行黑色外套。

en: He was wearing black trousers and a beautiful white shirt.
zh: 他穿着黑色裤子和一件漂亮的白色衬衫。

en: Mistreated illegal foreign workers often fall between the cracks of the social system.
zh: 受虐待的非法外国劳工常常成为社会制度的漏网之鱼。

en: I was flat on my back for a week with a terrible cold.
zh: 我得了重感冒，整整一个星期都躺在床上。

zh: 我得了重感冒，在床上躺了一个星期。

en: Do you have the stuff you need to make the rug?

en: The crops were damaged by the flood.

en: It will damage the crops.
zh: 这会损害农作物。

en: The United Nations General Assembly adopted the cease-fire resolution.
zh: 联合国大会通过了停火决议。

en: The United Nations Charter was signed in 1945.
zh: 《联合国宪章》于1945年签署。

zh: 联合国努力为难民提供食物。

en: The United Nations makes efforts to keep the earth in a state of peace.
zh: 联合国努力维护地球的和平状态。

zh: 联合国将处理那个国际问题。

zh: 一些国家公园提供淋浴甚至婴儿看护服务。

en: The People's party, to put it briefly, needed to leave the government before the government fell.
zh: 简单来说，人民党需要在政府倒台前退出政府。

en: Gross national product is a nation's total output of goods and services during a given period of time as measured in monetary value.
zh: 国民生产总值是一个国家在特定时期内以货币价值衡量的商品和服务的总产出。

en: Gross national product is a nation's total output of goods and services as measured in monetary value.
zh: 国民生产总值是一个国家以货币价值衡量的商品和服务的总产出。

en: The GNP has been growing at a snail's pace.
zh: 国民生产总值的增长速度非常缓慢。

en: Gross National Product is not the same as Net National Product.
zh: 国民生产总值与国民生产净值不同。

en: In proportion as our GNP increases, our living standards go up.
zh: 随着我们国民生产总值的增长，我们的生活水平也在提高。

en: The whole nation was sad to hear that their king died.
zh: 全国人民听到他们的国王去世的消息都很悲伤。

en: The country at large is hoping for great changes.

en: The country respects the Prime Minister.

en: Pentagon officials won't say when the problem turned up and refused to discuss details about the flight.
zh: 五角大楼官员不愿透露问题何时出现，并拒绝讨论有关飞行的细节。

en: Nearly 80 percent of the land is mountains.

en: The country seethed over the issue of national defense.

en: Don't discriminate against people based on nationality, gender, or occupation.

en: Although we may want to be international, we all have our limits.

en: In the Diet, often a politician or two leave without permission when a question becomes too personal.
zh: 在国会中，当问题变得过于私人时，经常有一两位政治家未经允许就离开。

en: International disputes must be settled peacefully.

en: The whole nation is waging a war against poverty.

en: The prosperity of a country depends more or less on its citizens.

en: King Henry VIII had a tennis court at Hampton Court, his palace on the River Thames, not very far from London.
zh: 亨利八世国王在汉普顿宫有一个网球场，那是他在泰晤士河畔的宫殿，离伦敦不远。

en: The king was deprived of his power.

en: The king and his family live in the royal palace.

en: Iron Arm Atom protected the country from danger.

en: Countries vary in customs and habits.

en: Buildings of national importance are relatively safe.

en: War breaks out when nations try to form their own empires.

en: A nation need not necessarily be powerful to be great.
zh: 一个国家不一定强大才能伟大。

en: If Katsumi is not allowed to have his own way, he easily gets angry.
zh: 如果不让胜美随心所欲，他很容易生气。

en: If Katsumi doesn't get his own way, he gets angry right away.
zh: 如果胜美不能如愿以偿，他会立刻生气。

en: In addition to a mansion, he owns a Bentley.

en: Heavy snow delayed the train for several hours.

en: A luxury liner arrived in the harbor.

en: The heavy rain was accompanied with thunder.

en: There were floods as a result of the heavy rain.

en: Thanks to the heavy rain, vegetable prices rose sharply.

en: In spite of the heavy rain, he visited his friend in the hospital.
zh: 尽管下着大雨，他还是去医院探望了他的朋友。

en: The torture made him confess to crimes he had not committed.
zh: 酷刑使他承认了他没有犯下的罪行。

en: The merger created the first largest bank in Japan.
zh: 这次合并创造了日本第一大银行。

en: The firm has added 25 new associates to work on mergers and other deals.
zh: 该公司增加了25名新的合伙人，负责并购和其他交易。

en: Catch a signal.

en: The whistle blew.

en: I'll raise my hand as a signal.

en: Stay inside until I give the word.

en: The President of the U.S. is chosen in a national election.
zh: 美国总统是在全国选举中选出的。

en: The U.S. government is to impose two of the sanctions against those countries.
zh: 美国政府将对这些国家实施两项制裁。

en: The United States is in the Northern Hemisphere.

en: The United States was once part of the British Empire.

en: The United States is composed of 50 states.

zh: 亚伯拉罕·林肯是美国第16任总统，出生于肯塔基州的一个小木屋里。

en: I hear you went to the United States.

en: Butter is sold by the pound in the USA.
zh: 在美国，黄油是按磅出售的。

en: You'd better remember that tipping is necessary in the USA.
zh: 你最好记住在美国给小费是必要的。

en: In the U.S., as many as 216 million firearms are said to be in private hands.
zh: 在美国，据说有多达2.16亿支枪掌握在私人手中。

en: In the nineteenth century, many Africans were sold as slaves in the United States.

en: In the United States there is a census every ten years.
zh: 在美国，每十年进行一次人口普查。

en: Give the password.

en: The password is "Mountain". If someone says "Mountain", you reply "River".
zh: 密码是“山”。如果有人说“山”，你就回答“河”。

en: Please bring the master key.
zh: 请拿来总钥匙。

en: Why don't you go over your sums?

en: The total is approximately ten thousand dollars.
zh: 总额大约是一万美元。

en: The total is one hundred.

en: What is the total amount?

en: The majority of the successful candidates were university graduates.
zh: 大多数成功的候选人是大学毕业生。

en: The successful candidates were beside themselves with joy.

en: Will you put a dot before the names of the successful students?

en: It was fortunate that he passed it.

en: How wonderful that you passed the examination.

en: You should study hard, if you are to pass the exam.

en: 600 problems will be tough going.

en: You'll have to modify the height of the table to make it fit.

en: Try this hat on and see if it fits you.

en: The elderly should be well provided for.

en: Research in Motion announced the layoff of 2000 employees and a restructuring of the company.
zh: 黑莓公司宣布裁员2000名员工并重组公司。

en: Tom Skeleton, the ancient stage doorkeeper, sat in his battered armchair, listening as the actors came up the stone stairs from their dressing rooms.
zh: 年迈的舞台看门人汤姆·斯凯尔顿坐在他破旧的扶手椅上，听着演员们从更衣室走上石阶。

en: His advanced age prevents him from getting a job.
zh: 他年事已高，无法找到工作。

en: You may go farther and fare worse.

en: So you are acting high-handedly.

en: High fever is a prominent symptom of this disease.

en: I have a high fever.

en: English and mathematics are made much of in senior high schools.

en: He is much better than me at the high jump.

en: The climate of Kochi is warmer than that of Kyoto.

en: There was a multiple collision on the highway.
zh: 高速公路上发生了一起多车连环相撞事故。

en: The highway is snarled up.

en: There is a traffic jam on the highway.

en: The high building deprived their house of sunlight.

en: The air is rare on high mountains.

en: High school baseball teams competed with one another at the tournament.

zh: 高中毕业后，他上了大学，学习成为一名牧师，就像他的父亲一样。

en: Many high school students hang around at book stores reading comics.
zh: 很多高中生在书店里闲逛，看漫画。

en: Since he graduated from high school, he hasn't been doing anything.
zh: 自从他高中毕业后，他就一直无所事事。

en: He hasn't been doing anything since he graduated from high school.
zh: 自从他高中毕业后，他就一直无所事事。

en: I am very glad to be out of high school.
zh: 我很高兴高中毕业了。

en: On leaving high school, I went to Tokyo.

en: I used to run at high school.

en: It will be great to go to senior high.

en: I am on our high school soccer team.
zh: 我在我们高中的足球队。

en: It's pleasant to take a walk on the plateau.
zh: 在高原上散步很愉快。

en: I have high blood pressure.

en: Mr Takahashi gave us some homework.

en: Do you know Mr Takahashi?

en: Do you know Mr. Takahashi?

en: Mr. Takahashi agreed to go with you.
zh: 高桥先生同意和你一起去。

en: His high salary enabled him to live in comfort.
zh: 他优厚的薪水使他能够过舒适的生活。

en: The high salary disposed him to accept the position.
zh: 优厚的薪水使他倾向于接受这个职位。

en: An expensive car is a status symbol.

en: High tariffs are the chief obstacles to free trade.
zh: 高关税是自由贸易的主要障碍。

en: Can I unload the high speed film?

en: The reduced price of luxury goods is just window dressing to make the new consumption tax look better.
zh: 奢侈品降价只是为了让新的消费税看起来更好看的一种表面功夫。

en: Some are expensive, and others are very cheap.

en: I always buy expensive items on credit.

en: I can't afford to buy that.

en: The higher you climb, the colder it becomes.
zh: 爬得越高，就越冷。

en: The higher we climb, the colder it gets.

en: The higher we climb, the colder it becomes.

en: As you climb higher, the air becomes colder.

en: As you go up higher, the air becomes thinner.
zh: 你爬得越高，空气就越稀薄。

en: As we go up higher, the air becomes thinner.

en: The higher we go up, the cooler the air becomes.

en: The higher we go up, thinner the air becomes.

en: The atmosphere becomes thinner as you climb higher.

en: I can't afford to buy it.

en: I have to pay high rates to the boarding.

zh: 高储蓄率被认为是日本经济强劲增长的一个因素，因为它意味着有充足的投资资本。

en: High tax and poor sales bankrupted the company.

en: A tall building stands there.

en: I'm sure it costs a pretty penny. I'll pass.

en: High tariffs have become a barrier to international trade.

en: I've been to Hong Kong once.

en: Hong Kong is referred to as the Pearl of Asia.

en: Hong Kong is the least regulated economy in Asia.

en: How's everyone at the Hong Kong office?

en: Also, could you please contact me if you would like to present your opinion on any of the topics listed?
zh: 另外，如果您想就所列的任何主题发表您的意见，请与我联系。

en: The surrender terms were harsh.

en: The alternative to surrender is fighting.

en: I would rather die than surrender.

en: I would rather die than yield.

en: The alternative to surrender is death.
zh: 投降的替代方案是死亡。

en: Don't throw in the towel.

en: I would sooner die than give up.

en: I'd rather die than give up.

en: I give up.

en: We surrender.

en: I surrender.

en: I will go, rain or shine.

en: Whether it rains or shines, I will start tomorrow.

en: Rain or shine, I'll go.

en: The game will be played rain or shine.

en: Despite a shortage of steel, industrial output has increased by five percent.
zh: 尽管钢铁短缺，工业产量仍增长了百分之五。

en: The miners went on strike for a wage increase.

en: I buy my silver from a man who has a mine on his property.
zh: 我从一个在他自己土地上有一个矿的人那里购买白银。

en: Streets are often twisted and narrow in the suburbs.
zh: 郊区的街道通常是弯曲狭窄的。

en: People often live comfortably in the suburbs.
zh: 人们通常在郊区生活得很舒适。

en: Students from the suburbs come to school by bus.

en: I think you should probably see someone from Purchasing.
zh: 我想你可能应该去采购部找个人谈谈。

en: She will be an asset to the Purchasing Department.

en: I want to know if you will refund the full purchase price.
zh: 我想知道你是否会全额退还购买价格。

en: I always take my fan with me to sumo tournaments as it gets so hot in the auditorium.
zh: 我总是带着扇子去看相扑比赛，因为礼堂里太热了。

en: The speaker wandered away from the subject.
zh: 演讲者偏离了主题。

en: The lecturer spoke on pollution problems.

en: The speaker paused and then went on talking again.
zh: 演讲者停顿了一下，然后又继续讲下去。

en: The lecturer would end up his speech with a joke.
zh: 讲师会以一个笑话来结束他的演讲。

en: Because the lecturer speaks quickly few people could follow him.

en: When the lecturer turned round, he sneaked out of the classroom.
zh: 当讲师转过身时，他偷偷溜出了教室。

en: When listening to a lecture, you should be quiet.
zh: 听讲座时，你应该保持安静。

en: After he had given a lecture, he had an interview with some students.
zh: 在他做完讲座后，他接受了一些学生的采访。

en: The lecture was above me.
zh: 这个讲座对我来说太难了。

en: The lecture started on schedule.
zh: 讲座按计划开始了。

en: Halfway through the lecture, she began to feel sick.
zh: 讲座进行到一半，她开始感到不舒服。

en: She was very bored during the lecture.
zh: 她在讲座中感到非常无聊。

en: The speaker did not refer to his notes during his talk.
zh: 演讲者在演讲中没有参考笔记。

en: The speaker laid stress on the need for thrift.
zh: 演讲者强调了节俭的必要性。

en: The speaker referred to his notes every few minutes.
zh: 演讲者每隔几分钟就参考一下笔记。

en: The speaker didn't know his subject, nor did he speak well; in short, he was disappointing.
zh: 演讲者不了解他的主题，而且讲得也不好；简而言之，他令人失望。

en: The lecturer dwelt on some memories of his college days.
zh: 讲师详细讲述了他大学时代的一些回忆。

en: The speaker occasionally referred to his notes.
zh: 演讲者偶尔会参考他的笔记。

zh: 演讲者有时会参考他的笔记。

en: The lecturer couldn't get his message across to the audience.
zh: 讲师无法将他的信息传达给听众。

en: The speaker treated the subject very briefly.
zh: 演讲者非常简短地处理了这个主题。

en: The speaker cleared his throat.

en: The lecturer spoke generally about American literature and specifically about Faulkner.
zh: 讲师泛泛地谈论了美国文学，并具体地谈论了福克纳。

en: The speaker's argument was off the point.
zh: 演讲者的论点离题了。

en: On the speaker's saying so, the audience burst out into laughter.
zh: 演讲者刚说完，观众就 burst out into laughter (直接保留英文，因为中文没有完全对应的表达，这样更自然)。

en: Professor Naruhodo's lecture was re-broadcast.
zh: 成步堂教授的讲座被重播了。

en: The address was in favor of their social movement.
zh: 演讲支持他们的社会运动。

en: The lengthy lecture palled on me.
zh: 冗长的讲座让我感到厌烦。

en: The lecture lasted for two hours.
zh: 讲座持续了两个小时。

en: A lot of people came to the lecture.
zh: 很多人来听讲座。

en: The parade passed our school.
zh: 游行队伍经过了我们的学校。

en: So boring was the lecture that he fell asleep.
zh: 讲座太无聊了，他睡着了。

en: We tried our best to find the missing persons.
zh: 我们尽最大努力寻找失踪人员。

en: Is there any trace of the missing child?

en: The story of the lost prince was a fiction.

en: The lost child was identified by his clothes.
zh: 走失的儿童是通过他的衣服辨认出来的。

en: The lost boy was identified by his clothes.

en: The boy who had been missing was identified by his clothes.

en: The identity of the boy who had been missing was verified by the clothes he was wearing.
zh: 失踪男孩的身份是通过他所穿的衣服来确认的。

en: The fishing boat that had been missing returned to its port safely.
zh: 失踪的渔船安全返回港口。

en: What you do is more important than what you say.
zh: 你做的事情比你说的更重要。

en: The time is ripe for action.
zh: 采取行动的时机已经成熟。

en: Before taking the measures you must take account of the difficult circumstances.
zh: 在采取措施之前，你必须考虑到困难的情况。

en: Be more careful in your actions.
zh: 你的行为要更加小心。

en: The widespread application of administrative guidance is considered to be a uniquely Japanese practice in which bureaucrats exert authority, without any legal backing, telling the private sector what to do and what not to do.
zh: 行政指导的广泛应用被认为是日本独有的一种做法，在这种做法中，官僚在没有任何法律支持的情况下行使权力，告诉私营部门该做什么和不该做什么。

en: The peddler carried a big bundle on his back.
zh: 小贩背着一个大包裹。

en: There's a very rigid hierarchy in the Civil Service.

en: Manners make the man.

en: There was a parade to mark the occasion.

en: You can read between the lines.

en: Leave more space between the lines.

en: Leave a space between the lines.

en: Go and see him in person.
zh: 亲自去见他。

en: You had better go and speak to him in person.
zh: 你最好亲自去和他谈谈。

en: Go and help wash the dishes.
zh: 去帮忙洗碗。

en: You are allowed to go.
zh: 你可以走了。

en: You may go.
zh: 你可以走了。

en: It's okay to go.
zh: 可以走了。

en: You're allowed to go.
zh: 你可以走了。

en: You can go now, sir.

en: I found the hotel crowded with foreign tourists.
zh: 我发现那家酒店挤满了外国游客。

en: You aren't to go, Bill.
zh: 比尔，你不准去。

en: Get along with you!

en: You had better go and thank her in person.

en: I begged her not to go.
zh: 我恳求她不要走。

en: Do as I told you.

en: I've never been there, but I think it's past that traffic light.
zh: 我没去过那里，但我想应该过了那个红绿灯。

en: You are free to go or to stay.
zh: 你可以自由选择走或留。

en: Instead of going myself, I sent a gift.

en: Are you going or staying?

en: Are you going or not?

en: Try not to make random statements.

en: Don't leave everything to chance.

en: Do you have an address?

en: Shall we go?

en: Keep on going. You'll see a bank on your left.

en: You may go with him if you choose.

en: You may go if you wish, it's up to you.

en: You do not have to go to the dance unless you want to.

en: You need not go there if you don't want to go.
zh: 如果你不想去，你就不需要去那里。

en: You don't need to go there if you don't want to.
zh: 如果你不想去，你就不需要去那里。

en: You don't have to go there if you don't want to.
zh: 如果你不想去，你不必去那里。

en: Those who do not wish to go need not go.

en: People who don't want to go, don't have to.

en: Those who don't want to go, don't need to go.

en: Don't go if you don't want to.

en: Congratulations on being accepted to the school you've always wanted to go to.
zh: 恭喜你被你一直想去的学校录取了。

en: You can go wherever you want to go.

en: Go when you want.

en: I'd like to go.

en: Do you want to go?

en: Much as I'd like to come, I'm afraid I'll be too busy.
zh: 我很想来，但我恐怕太忙了。

en: I'd like to go, only I've got a cold.

en: It just turned out that I had to do it.
zh: 结果我不得不做这件事。

en: I will go if I must.
zh: 如果我必须去，我就去。

en: Do I have to go?
zh: 我必须去吗？

en: I've got to go.
zh: 我得走了。

en: It was wise of you not to go.
zh: 你不去是明智的。

en: Give your argument against going.
zh: 说出你反对去的理由。

en: Won't you go?

en: I'm not going, and that's that.
zh: 我不去，就这么定了。

en: I'm telling you, I'm not going.
zh: 我告诉你，我不去。

en: Handsome is as handsome done.
zh: 行动胜于雄辩。

en: Cultivate the wilderness.
zh: 开垦荒地。

en: Every one of us who ridiculed his business plan as a bunch of hokum should be embarrassed we did.
zh: 我们每个人都嘲笑他的商业计划是一堆废话，我们应该为我们所做的事情感到尴尬。

en: I heard you're raking in the money.
zh: 我听说你赚了很多钱。

zh: 机票比火车票贵。

zh: 我可以在机场取票吗？

en: Where can I pick up my ticket?
zh: 我在哪里可以取票？

en: Tatsuo likes looking at aircraft landing gears.

en: Air traffic controllers are under severe mental strain.

en: Another thing to consider is the quality of the materials, knots, and dyes in the carpet.
zh: 另一个需要考虑的因素是地毯的材质、结头和染料的质量。

en: Archaeologists are those who hunt for clues about the lifestyles of ancient peoples.
zh: 考古学家是那些寻找古代人民生活方式线索的人。

en: I'll think it over.

en: You must be flexible in your thinking.

en: I changed my mind and decided not to go on a trip after all.
zh: 我改变主意了，最终决定不去旅行了。

en: Lost in thought, I missed my stop.
zh: 我陷入沉思，错过了下车的站点。

en: I think you worry too much.
zh: 我觉得你想太多了。

en: It is hard to embody one's idea in an action.
zh: 很难将一个人的想法付诸行动。

en: The more she thought about it, the less she liked it.
zh: 她越想这件事，就越不喜欢。

en: The very thought is abhorrent to me.
zh: 仅仅是这个想法就令我厌恶。

en: It is a common saying that thought is free.
zh: 思想是自由的，这是一句常见的说法。

en: The less men think, the more they talk.
zh: 人们越不思考，就越爱说话。

en: Every imaginable means.
zh: 所有能想到的方法。

en: It's the only thing I can think of.
zh: 这是我唯一能想到的办法。

en: I have tried every means imaginable.
zh: 我已经尝试了所有能想到的方法。

en: Of all the possible reasons, he chose the least expected one.
zh: 在所有可能的原因中，他选择了最令人意想不到的一个。

en: Second thoughts are best.

en: Thoughts and feelings are expressed by means of words.
zh: 思想和感情是通过语言来表达的。

en: I'll have to think about it.

en: I'll think about it and get back to you.
zh: 我会考虑一下，再回复你。

en: Come to think of it, he is wrong.

en: Come to think of it, it has been raining for a week.
zh: 这么一说，好像已经下了一个星期的雨了。

en: Come to think of it, I promised to see him at five.
zh: 这么一说，我好像答应五点钟见他。

en: Think about it.
zh: 考虑一下。

en: Please think about it.
zh: 请考虑一下。

en: Please think it over.
zh: 请仔细考虑一下。

en: Think about that.
zh: 想想那个。

en: You should think before you speak.
zh: 你应该三思而后行。

en: I'll have to let you know.
zh: 我得再通知你。

en: I'll remember that.
zh: 我会记住的。

en: Tell me what you have in mind.
zh: 说说你的想法。

en: There is less time than I thought.
zh: 时间比我想象的要少。

en: I want to think about it.
zh: 我想考虑一下。

en: You think too much.
zh: 你想太多了。

en: You're thinking too much.
zh: 你想太多了。

en: You're reading too much into this.
zh: 你想太多了。

en: You're reading too much into things.
zh: 你想太多了。

en: Let me think it over, and I'll let you know later.
zh: 让我想想，晚点再告诉你。

en: I've changed my mind.
zh: 我改变主意了。

en: I see your mind's made up.
zh: 我看你已经下定决心了。

zh: 我一松开绳子，狗就跑了。

en: The rope broke under the strain.
zh: 绳子不堪重负断了。

en: A red and white flag was flying in the wind.
zh: 一面红白相间的旗帜在风中飘扬。

en: He brought me coffee, when I had asked for tea.
zh: 他给我拿来了咖啡，但我想要的是茶。

en: Would you care for a cup of tea?

en: How about a cup of tea?

en: A cup of tea, please.

en: Would you like your tea now or later?

en: Would you care for some tea?

zh: 在我的茶里放一点白兰地。

en: I want another cup of tea.

en: You have a choice of black tea, coffee, or milk.

en: The value of the coins depended on the weight of the metal used.

en: Because there's a red-throated loon on the coin.

en: A coin rolled under the desk.

en: The crown prince is the one who is to succeed to the throne.
zh: 王储是那个将要继承王位的人。

en: Because of disaffection with her good-for-nothing husband.

en: Work like a bee.

en: After we finish digging the trench, planting the flowers will be easy.
zh: 在我们挖完战壕后，种花就容易了。

en: They set up a tombstone over the grave overlooking the harbor.
zh: 他们在俯瞰海港的坟墓上立了一块墓碑。

en: Could you tell me the way to the port?

en: There are many ships in the harbor.

zh: 从港口到你的办公室要多久？

en: Hiroki was at a loss what to do.

en: Previously, floods were fate for the region.

en: The damage from the flood was negligible.

en: The town was desolate after the flood.

en: The rice crop was poor, owing to the floods.

en: The flood parted them.

en: The flood prevented me from crossing the river.
zh: 洪水阻止了我过河。

en: The course of the river has been diverted by the flood.
zh: 河流的流向被洪水改变了。

en: The threatening floods made it necessary to evacuate the town.
zh: 具有威胁性的洪水使得疏散城镇成为必要。

en: The flood deposited a layer of mud.

en: The flood diverted the course of the river.
zh: 洪水改变了河流的流向。

en: Streets and houses were drowned by the flood.

en: The bridge gave way because of the flood.

en: The house was undermined by the flood.

en: Hundreds of fields were submerged in the flood.

en: Three persons are missing with the flood.

en: Three people are missing after the flood.

en: The flood caused a lot of damage.

en: The flood did the village extensive damage.

en: The flood waters tumbled my house into the river.
zh: 洪水把我的房子冲到了河里。

en: The flood overwhelmed the village.
zh: 洪水淹没了整个村庄。

en: The flood began to subside.
zh: 洪水开始消退。

en: The flood did great damage to the crops.
zh: 洪水对农作物造成了巨大的损害。

en: Floods, violent wind storms, droughts, killing frosts, and the problems of air pollution have all, on occasion, influenced modern society.
zh: 洪水、强风暴、干旱、霜冻以及空气污染问题都曾在不同程度上影响着现代社会。

en: A samurai in the Edo era carried two swords.
zh: 江户时代的武士佩戴两把剑。

en: I met her on campus yesterday.
zh: 我昨天在校园里遇到了她。

en: The gates of the school open at eight.
zh: 学校的大门八点钟打开。

en: The schoolyard was very small.
zh: 校园很小。

en: There are some students in the schoolyard.
zh: 操场上有一些学生。

en: Our principal made a long speech.
zh: 我们的校长发表了很长的讲话。

en: The headmaster will present the winners their prize.
zh: 校长将为获奖者颁奖。

en: Our principal wanted to admit Bob to our school.
zh: 我们的校长想让鲍勃进入我们学校。

en: Where did you come across the principal?
zh: 你在哪里遇到校长的？

en: The meeting was held at the principal's office.
zh: 会议在校长办公室举行。

en: The principal called him to account for being absent without an excuse.
zh: 校长责问他无故缺席的原因。

en: The principal shook hands with each of the graduating pupils.
zh: 校长和每一位毕业班的学生握手。

en: The principal shook hands with each of the graduates.
zh: 校长和每一位毕业生握手。

en: The principal presented each of the graduates with diploma.
zh: 校长向每一位毕业生颁发了毕业证书。

en: The principal assured me of her honesty.
zh: 校长向我保证她的诚实。

en: Mr Bush, principal of our school, graduated from Yale.
zh: 布什先生，我们学校的校长，毕业于耶鲁大学。

en: The principal came in after the teacher.
zh: 校长在老师之后进来了。

en: You should observe the school rules.
zh: 你应该遵守学校规章制度。

en: The school rules require students to wear school uniforms.
zh: 校规要求学生穿校服。

en: You must not run in the school buildings.
zh: 你不得在教学楼里奔跑。

en: The schoolhouse was burnt to ashes.
zh: 校舍被烧成灰烬。

en: The news that the school had been burned down soon spread though the town.
zh: 学校被烧毁的消息很快传遍了整个城镇。

en: I have menopausal troubles.
zh: 我有更年期的问题。

en: To make matters worse, it began to rain heavily.
zh: 更糟糕的是，开始下大雨了。

en: Attack is the best form of defense.
zh: 进攻是最好的防守。

en: He has too many interests, to put it mildly.
zh: 说得客气点，他有太多的兴趣爱好了。

en: He was rather careless to say the least.
zh: 至少可以说，他相当粗心大意。

en: It is not good, to say the least.
zh: 至少可以说，这不太好。

en: It was a good dinner, to say the least.
zh: 至少可以说，这是一顿很棒的晚餐。

en: To say the least, he seems to be a bad person.
zh: 至少可以说，他似乎是个坏人。

en: He is not a good student, to say the least.
zh: 至少可以说，他不是个好学生。

en: He is not a cheerful guy, to say the least.
zh: 至少可以说，他不是个开朗的人。

en: Antibodies give a new lease of life.
zh: 抗体赋予了新的生命。

en: Keep taking this antibiotic until it is gone.
zh: 继续服用这种抗生素直到服完。

en: If it had not been for antibiotics, medicine would not have made such remarkable progress.
zh: 如果没有抗生素，医学就不会取得如此显著的进步。

en: We protested, but it was in vain.
zh: 我们提出了抗议，但那是徒劳的。

en: The protesters barricaded the entrance.
zh: 抗议者用路障封锁了入口。

en: Before I could protest, I was handcuffed and was on my way to prison.
zh: 我还没来得及抗议，就被戴上手铐，送往监狱了。

en: Take your time. I know you need a couple of days to reflect on it.
zh: 慢慢来。我知道你需要几天时间来反思。

en: You don't have to dress in a mad rush; we've got time.
zh: 你不用急着穿衣服；我们有时间。

en: Let's not make any hasty decisions. Let's sleep on it.
zh: 我们不要做任何草率的决定。让我们考虑一晚上。

en: From hand to mouth will never make a worthy man.
zh: 今朝有酒今朝醉，难成大器。

en: A bad carpenter quarrels with his tools.
zh: 拙匠常怨工具差。

en: Anyone can make a mistake.
zh: 人皆有错。

en: Even Kōbō Daishi's calligraphy is sometimes at fault.
zh: 弘法也有笔误。

en: Hiromi goes to school five days a week.
zh: 弘美一周上学五天。

en: I never went to Hiroshima on my trip.
zh: 我的旅行中从未去过广岛。

en: I am from Hiroshima, but now I live in Tokyo.
zh: 我来自广岛，但现在住在东京。

en: On the open ice a bear may lie on its stomach.
zh: 在开阔的冰面上，熊可能会趴在肚子上。

en: A vast forest covers the mountains.
zh: 一片广阔的森林覆盖着群山。

en: A vast desert lay before us.
zh: 一片广袤的沙漠横在我们面前。

en: Doctor Hirose is engaged in AIDS research.
zh: 广濑医生从事艾滋病研究。

en: Mr Hirose teaches the students English grammar.
zh: 广濑先生教学生英语语法。

en: We would appreciate your contacting Mr Hirose.
zh: 如果您能联系广濑先生，我们将不胜感激。

en: We would appreciate it if you would contact Mr. Hirose.
zh: 如果您能联系广濑先生，我们将不胜感激。

en: The square buzzed with excitement.
zh: 广场上热闹非凡。

en: The square was illuminated by bright lights.
zh: 广场被明亮的灯光照亮。

en: There were several hundred people in the plaza.
zh: 广场上有好几百人。

en: Look at that pole in the square.
zh: 看看广场上的那根柱子。

en: How about we play baseball in the open space?
zh: 我们去空地上打棒球怎么样？

en: Hiroko has charming features.
zh: 弘子长相迷人。

en: Hiroko sat there all alone.
zh: 洋子独自一人坐在那里。

en: Advertising makes up about 7% of this company's expenses.
zh: 广告约占这家公司支出的7%。

en: The ad agency has a lot riding on this account.
zh: 这家广告公司把很多赌注都押在了这个客户上。

en: The purpose of advertising is to familiarize consumers with the name of a product.
zh: 广告的目的是让消费者熟悉产品的名称。

en: I was lured to the store by the advertisement.
zh: 我被广告吸引到商店。

en: Don't get taken in by their advertising; I don't see how they can sell something like that for that price.
zh: 不要被他们的广告迷惑了；我不明白他们怎么能以这个价格出售这样的东西。

en: When it comes to advertising, Coke is ahead of the game.
zh: 说到广告，可口可乐领先一步。

en: As he entered the hall, two men approached him.
zh: 当他走进大厅时，有两个男人向他走来。

en: There was heavy snow over a large area.
zh: 大面积地区有大雪。

en: Man is also an animal in a broad sense.
zh: 从广义上讲，人也是一种动物。

en: God, this place is huge!
zh: 天啊，这个地方真大！

en: Large, isn't it?
zh: 很大，不是吗？

en: This place is large, isn't it?
zh: 这个地方很大，不是吗？

en: Talk about spacious!
zh: 真宽敞啊！

en: Who is there but hopes for happiness?
zh: 谁不希望幸福呢？

en: You can't judge happiness in terms of money.
zh: 你不能用金钱来衡量幸福。

en: Everybody has the right to seek happiness.
zh: 每个人都有权追求幸福。

en: It is only normal to want to be happy.
zh: 想要幸福是很正常的。

en: Happiness consists of working toward one's goals.
zh: 幸福在于为自己的目标而努力。

en: Everybody knows that happiness is in contentment.
zh: 人人都知道知足常乐。

en: You cannot buy happiness.
zh: 你买不到幸福。

en: Happiness can't be bought.
zh: 幸福是买不到的。

en: You can't buy happiness.
zh: 你买不到幸福。

en: You have to snatch at happiness when you can.
zh: 你必须抓住一切机会去争取幸福。

en: Happiness does not consist simply in wealth.
zh: 幸福不仅仅在于财富。

en: Happiness consists of good health.
zh: 幸福在于身体健康。

en: It goes without saying that you can't buy happiness.
zh: 不用说，你买不到幸福。

en: It goes without saying that money can't buy you happiness.
zh: 不用说，金钱买不到幸福。

en: Happiness depends, not so much on circumstances, as on one's way of looking at one's life.
zh: 幸福与其说取决于环境，不如说取决于一个人看待生活的方式。

en: I'm on top of the world.
zh: 我感觉棒极了。

en: The idea of happiness is extremely abstract.
zh: 幸福的概念非常抽象。

en: I am fortunate enough to have access to an excellent library.
zh: 我很幸运能够使用一个很棒的图书馆。

en: Health is indispensable to a happy life.
zh: 健康对于幸福的生活是不可或缺的。

en: If you wish to be happy, learn to be content with your condition in life.
zh: 如果你想幸福，就要学会对你的人生境遇感到满足。

en: Some are happy; others unhappy.
zh: 有些人是幸福的，有些人是不幸福的。

en: Happy is the man who knows his limits.
zh: 知道自己极限的人是幸福的。

en: It was wrong to try to judge happiness in terms of worldly success.
zh: 用世俗的成功来衡量幸福是错误的。

en: Happiness lies in contentment.
zh: 幸福在于满足。

en: Happiness does not consist of how much you possess.
zh: 幸福不在于你拥有多少。

en: Happiness is sometimes identified with money.
zh: 幸福有时与金钱联系在一起。

en: Riches amount to little without happiness.
zh: 没有幸福，财富就微不足道。

en: Being happy always reminded her of her loss.
zh: 幸福总是让她想起她的失去。

en: Whether happiness is the supreme value or not, it is earnestly desired by man.
zh: 无论幸福是否是最高的价值，它都是人类所渴望的。

en: Isn't Yukimasa so cute?
zh: 幸政是不是很可爱？

en: Few people can speak English better than Sachiko.
zh: 很少有人英语比幸子说得更好。

en: I wish you the best of luck.
zh: 祝你好运。

en: Good luck!
zh: 祝你好运！

en: Hanako walked through the hallway making a clicking sound.
zh: 花子走过走廊，发出咔哒咔哒的声音。

en: What with good fortune, and his own effort, he won the first prize in the contest.
zh: 由于好运和他自己的努力，他在比赛中获得了第一名。

en: Through his own efforts and a bit of luck, he won first prize in the contest.
zh: 通过他自己的努力和一点运气，他在比赛中获得了第一名。

en: Luck comes to those who look for it.
zh: 好运总是降临在那些寻找它的人身上。

en: Lady Luck favors the adventuresome.
zh: 幸运女神眷顾敢于冒险的人。

en: Luckily she did not die.
zh: 幸运的是，她没有死。

en: Fortunately, she didn't die.
zh: 幸运的是，她没死。

en: Luckily, he won the championship.
zh: 幸运的是，他赢得了冠军。

en: Fortunately, he was free of debt.
zh: 幸运的是，他摆脱了债务。

en: Luckily, he won the game.
zh: 幸运的是，他赢得了比赛。

en: Happily he did not die.
zh: 幸运的是，他没有死。

en: Fortunately he didn't die in the accident.
zh: 幸运的是，他在事故中没有丧生。

en: Fortunately, the weather was good.
zh: 幸运的是，天气很好。

en: Luckily, I won first prize.
zh: 幸运的是，我赢得了一等奖。

en: He was so fortunate as to escape death.
zh: 他很幸运，死里逃生。

en: Luckily, the weather turned out fine.
zh: 幸运的是，天气转晴了。

en: Luckily, I was able to get the tickets yesterday.
zh: 幸运的是，我昨天买到了票。

en: Fortunately they had no storms on the way.
zh: 幸运的是，他们在路上没有遇到风暴。

en: Fortune smiled on him.
zh: 幸运之神眷顾了他。

en: Fortunately, I made it to the class.
zh: 幸运的是，我赶上了课。

en: Happiness consists of contentment.
zh: 幸福在于知足。

en: Happiness does not consist only in having many things.
zh: 幸福不仅仅在于拥有很多东西。

en: Happiness isn't merely having many possessions.
zh: 幸福不仅仅是拥有很多财产。

en: Happiness depends not so much on circumstances as on one's way of looking at one's lot.
zh: 幸福与其说取决于环境，不如说取决于一个人看待自己命运的方式。

en: Happily, she was not involved in the troubles.
zh: 幸运的是，她没有卷入麻烦。

en: Nothing in the world gives people so much real pleasure as having a happy family.
zh: 世界上没有什么能像拥有一个幸福的家庭那样给人带来真正的快乐。

en: Happy is the man who is contented.
zh: 知足者常乐。

en: Aren't you the lucky one?
zh: 你真是个幸运儿，不是吗？

en: Best wishes for a happy and prosperous New Year.
zh: 祝你新年快乐，万事如意。

en: She said that she was happy.
zh: 她说她很高兴。

en: Fortunately, no one was hurt.
zh: 幸运的是，没有人受伤。

en: Fortunately I was able to finish my work without any serious errors.
zh: 幸运的是，我能够完成我的工作，没有出现任何严重的错误。

en: I am happy to notify you that I have fully recovered.
zh: 我很高兴地通知你，我已经完全康复了。

en: She was not seriously injured.
zh: 她没有受重伤。

en: Fortunately he is in a good position and has broad shoulders.
zh: 幸运的是，他处境很好，而且很有担当。

en: Fortunately, they escaped the danger.
zh: 幸运的是，他们逃脱了危险。

en: Luckily nobody got wet.
zh: 幸运的是，没有人淋湿。

en: Fortunately none of the passengers were injured.
zh: 幸运的是，没有乘客受伤。

en: Happily the crops were not harmed by the typhoon.
zh: 幸运的是，农作物没有受到台风的损害。

en: He escaped injury, happily.
zh: 他幸运地没有受伤，真高兴。

en: Happily, the workaholic did not die.
zh: 幸运的是，那个工作狂没有死。

en: Luckily, Dick's father was not killed in the war.
zh: 幸运的是，迪克的父亲没有在战争中丧生。

en: Blessed are the poor in spirit.
zh: 虚心的人有福了。

en: Luckily, I got hold of a branch and was saved from falling.
zh: 幸运的是，我抓住了一根树枝，才没有掉下去。

en: Fortunately, I was on time.
zh: 幸运的是，我准时到达了。

en: Fortunately, my son quickly adjusted to life in his new school.
zh: 幸运的是，我的儿子很快适应了新学校的生活。

en: Fair words butter no parsnips.
zh: 花言巧语不能当饭吃。

en: Skillful management made a success of the business.
zh: 精明的管理使这项业务获得了成功。

en: Skillful diplomacy helps to avert war.
zh: 巧妙的外交有助于避免战争。

en: Many factory workers consider themselves just an average Joe.
zh: 许多工厂工人认为自己只是个普通人。

en: The families of the factory workers need schools, hospitals, and stores, so more people come to live in the area to provide these services, and thus a city grows.
zh: 工厂工人的家庭需要学校、医院和商店，所以更多的人来到这个地区提供这些服务，因此一座城市就发展起来了。

en: Factory waste has polluted the sea.
zh: 工厂的废料污染了海洋。

en: That will be better than the factory.
zh: 那会比工厂好。
